meanings.definition: A plan or course of action taken to achieve a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: Her measures to improve her grades included studying every day.
meanings.sent2: The company implemented new measures to increase productivity.
meanings.sent3: His measure to impress his crush was to learn to play guitar.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of good versus evil, love was the measure that tipped the scales.
meanings.sent5: The measure of a true friend is someone who stands by you in tough times.

meanings.definition: A unit or standard used for comparison.
meanings.sent1: The meter is a common measure used for distance.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used the rubric as a measure of student performance.
meanings.sent3: The measure of how much she loved chocolate was evident in her extensive collection.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, Beethoven's symphonies are the measure of excellence.
meanings.sent5: The measure of success is not always monetary wealth.

meanings.definition: The size, extent, or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The measure of the fish he caught was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The measure of rainfall this month was higher than usual.
meanings.sent3: The measure of his appetite was evident in the empty pizza boxes.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness knew no measure, always willing to help others.
meanings.sent5: The measure of happiness is different for each person.
